page.title: 03ECOLOGY,CLIMATE
page.content: Since most of the area comprises elevated upland it suffers from the cool,wet and windy climate which characterises the mountains of South and Central Wales. Apart from the rainfall data to be discussed on the next page, there are no meteorological data for the area. However the height and exposure corresponds to that for FAN FRYNYCH and PONT BLAEN-CWM-DU which lie 3 km further east. Here there is a short but continuous record of temperature and humidity for 26 months in 1958-1961. This has been described in the TRANS. INSTITUTE OF BRITISH GEOGRAPHERS,Vol 35,1964. It is summarised here under Grid Reference 02920222.
